channel.title: Wilderness Fence
channel.description:
Reines' or whoever removed the F2P/P2P separating fence but instead of just removing it whoever did it seems to have like painted tiles merrily so if you login to RSC and compare it doesn't really make sense where the fence should run. It's difficult to explain but basically I've logged into RSCE + RSC and that top line where the fence ran is a bit fucked up on private servers, so badly so that I didn't bother adding the fence back because it looked weird. I can't really remember exactly what was wrong but I know near the white mountain it looked really strange how it had been removed.
Now, does anyone have access to any landscape files prior to it being removed or any other suggestions? It would speed RSCD's development up as it's gunna hold us back a bit I think trying to get it sorted.

item.title: Wilderness Fence
item.dc:creator: @Jusba Jusba
item.description:
@Jusba wrote:

I’m shocked. We weren’t friends but this still hit me hard.

Its fucking weird… I was thinking of playing rscemulation today for the first time in over half a year. but yea that possibility dies with Luke the next time the server fails…
fuck… this is sad

Read full topic

It is unfortunate that there was not another to co-admin it. It is why I believe in open source code. What you create will remain even after you pass.

item.description:

[quote=“Dgc2002, post:19, topic:444793”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=547482.msg4015838#msg4015838 date=1339624795]

✯ i know this sounds horrible but is this really true that hes passed because on a skoda forum people are slagging him off saying his lieing and has faked his death befor this is all on briskoda its horrible xxxx

[/quote]
Which is exactly why i say its hard to confirm :\ No news reports show up when looking for it but that’s not too uncommon. Save judgement for more information I suppose[/quote]

I guess this means the RSCD Project is now done, and Rscemulation is going to shut down since if he has actually died, he wouldn’t be able to pay for it.

item.title: Wilderness Fence
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

His facebook’s getting spammed with RIPs and such.

http://www.bikechatforums.com/viewtopic.php?p=3219625

just to clear things up as so many people have heard and told many different things including myself. It's happened on the A228 in Hoo. Luke was riding with a mate turned around to see where he was, hit the kerb which has flung him off and he collided with a lamppost and died instantly. Thoughts go out to family and friends at this time. We may not have got on as well in recent times as we used too but I am still completely shocked. He always said he'd die on a bike, you never think it will happen though! Typically for Luke the last time I spoke to him this morning he was winding me up asking why the doors of my car are removed in the garage! To quote Luke "We're here for a good time not for a long time" RIP Luke Leary
twitter.com

Shaun O'Hara (WheelieShaun)

RIP @xa0s Who died today after a collision on the M2 while riding his GSXR 750. Rode like a demon and always had a laugh. You'll be missed.
11:17 - 13. Juni 2012
BRISKODA

Luke Leary R.I.P

Iv just heard that Luke xs0sx Has passed away I really looked up to him with his fabia and allways was friendly with tuneing advice. Can any one shed any li...

Read full topic

item.title: Wilderness Fence
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

Kryptix:

[quote author=RLN link=topic=547482.msg4014559#msg4014559 date=1339516778]Why would it be?

I’ve never looked into it myself but I remember KO9 saying xEnt was trying to make a landscape exporter because RSC hinted at updating and he wanted to future proof RSCA but never managed to do it so I always presumed it was some kind of hardship. Like xEnt was desperately trying to find a landscape with the tutorial island in it and even considered having someone make it from scratch, so I always kind of guessed it was a difficult task. Is it not then?[/quote]

he just wanted the one from early rscdaemon since xEnt is lazy
